categories.title: Twitter Activity from dankvr, elizaOS, shawmakesmagic, and autodotfun

content.text: dankvr discusses various crypto and tech topics, including Voxels being broken for over a year, the importance of blockchain transparency for tracking spending, and recommending Brave browser over Chrome. They also express interest in educational content about cryptocurrency fundamentals, security, and Bitcoin history for newcomers to the space.

elizaOS shares updates about their agent platform, highlighting features like calendar integration, plan updating, and memory capabilities. They announce that autodotfun is now 'in the wild' with a focus on being 'fun, but programmable.'

shawmakesmagic is working on AI agent development, including a Hyperfy Plugin for Eliza with movement, chat, and world state functionality. They note that tokens per second is the biggest barrier for complex agents, with Llama 3.1B on Groq providing 750 tps. They're also creating an AI agent called Spartan, which they jokingly refer to as their 'Frankenstein's monster.'

autodotfun announces partnerships with Astralabs_LN and their agent PAYXBT_LN, focusing on Lightning Network payments. They're also collaborating with Tapestry_AI and SteamBot_Willie to 'mine the public domain for memeable characters, stories, and chaos fuel.' The platform emphasizes transparency, community building, and being a place where 'the fun is made.'

Several plugins have been removed from the ElizaOS monorepo, including plugin-browser (#4406), plugin-anthropic (#4427), plugin-ollama (#4437), plugin-groq (#4436), and plugin-venice (#4434). This appears to be part of an ongoing effort to streamline the repository structure.

New features have been added, including the ability to use a unique pglite folder if one is not provided (#4423) and a Twitter timeline feature (#4429). Additionally, a hackish solution for copying migrations has been removed (#4422), and small fixes have been made to a template (#4431) and the Twitter plugin (#4430).

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new features and improvements have been added to the elizaOS/eliza repository through recent pull requests:

- Twitter integration has been enhanced with PR #4429 adding a Twitter timeline feature (by tcm390) and PR #4425 adding documentation for Twitter agent setup (by 0xbbjoker).

- Technical improvements include PR #4435 fixing incorrect version detection to show the correct latest CLI version (by yungalgo), PR #4423 implementing unique pglite folder usage if not provided (by wtfsayo), and PR #4442 fixing ESM type generation in multiple packages including SQL, Bootstrap & OpenAI (by michavie).

- Repository maintenance work includes PR #4439 removing plugin-local-ai from the monorepo (by 0xbbjoker), PR #4441 fixing typos (by rnkrtt), and PR #4443 fixing title spacing in documentation (by Dangoz).

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the Eliza Framework

content.text:
Three recent issues have been reported in the Eliza framework GitHub repository:

1. Issue #3745 reports a problem with the RAG processFile functionality, which attempts to embed entire files at once. This causes errors when processing large documents, suggesting a need for chunking or streaming implementation.

2. Issue #4432 is a job posting seeking a developer with specific experience in the Eliza framework.

3. Issue #4440 reports a TypeScript typing issue where the 'preconnect' property is missing in a type definition, causing development errors.

Over the past two days (May 2-4, 2025), the elizaos/eliza repository has shown significant activity. On May 2-3, there were 13 new pull requests with 7 being merged, along with 1 new issue and 8 active contributors. Activity decreased slightly on May 3-4, with only 3 new pull requests (none merged), 1 new issue, and 6 active contributors working on the project.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
